"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53730a236368726c9e460500#post_53730a236368726c9e460500

Well, because I work in a cybercafe and due the maintenance of the old PCs were somewhat expensive, my boss replaced all the old ones (10 exactly) and put new ones, better PCs. And guess where are all of those old PCs right now. In my house. 10 old PCs.
topics.author: 31bee2686368722a0df23600

topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53730baa6368725c83b80100#post_53730baa6368725c83b80100

I'm inclined to ask why, seriously, how did he convinced you to keep them?
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53730c396368725c97100200#post_53730c396368725c97100200

Because my boss live in the same building with me and all my family. 

[spoiler]Is my father[/spoiler]

And because all the PCs still work after 10 years of not being used, why throw them all? So he brought all of them in my house. There are five of them in my room, three in the second floor and two in one of my brother's closet.
topics.author: 31bee2686368722a0df23600

"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53738b2f6368726d3a8f0000#post_53738b2f6368726d3a8f0000
Not really. I could never not wear glasses. I've worn them since I was five years old. They're a part of me. A part of my identity. To me glasses are as much a part of my body as my eyes themselves.

Plus my boyfriend has the biggest glasses fetish in the world and I'm supportive like that.
